chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Naomi R. Seay-Alvarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Naomi R. Seay-Alvarez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Naomi R. Seay-Alvarez was found guilty of Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be applied.    
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  PD Michael Barth - if determined within 45 days.   
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

timeConds.notes: COMMENCE FORTHWITH  -  Huber privileges are allowed.  May be released for medical appts too.

Ct. 2
Ct. 1
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  14CF467/14CF1420/14CF1383.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  

14CF1420 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1, 2, & 3; admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI waived.

Sentencing arguments heard on all three files.  

14CF467 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years.  See conditions.  Deft ordered to serve 6mos KCJ on this file as a condition of probation.

14CF1383 - Count 1 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years.  See conditions
                     Count 5 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for three years.  See conditions

14CF1420 - Count 1 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years.  See conditions
                    Counts 2 & 3 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for three years each count.  See conditions.  If revoked, credit for 59 days on this file.  
                    This credit shall not be applied towards the 6mos conditional sentence ordered in 14CF467.

Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Bond on 14CF467 & 14CF1383 shall be applied towards financial obligations

Minutes:  14CF467 & 14CF1383.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Cases are resolved.

14CF467 - deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.

14CF1383 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 5; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater on both counts.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 2/2/15 @ 2:30pm.
